StockManager.SimpleDatabase.Columns

Class Column

  • java.lang.Object
    • StockManager.SimpleDatabase.Columns.Column
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanColumn, IntegerColumn, NumberColumn, TextColumn

    public abstract class Column
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a field in an object and also a column in a table. Too abstract for you? You shouldn't be looking at the implementation of this class to begin with.
    Since:
    09/11/2015

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Column() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void DBUpdateValue(java.lang.String new_value)
      Children implement this method to update their current value from the data extracted from the DB.
      java.lang.String Name()
      Gets this column's name.
      void SetName(java.lang.String s)
      Sets this column's name.
      static java.lang.String SQLColumnDescriptor()
      This method returns the column type that the database will use to store these columns.
      abstract java.lang.String SQLFieldValue()
      Children implement this method to return a string that can be injected directly into an SQL statement, representing the current value of this field.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Column

        public Column()

    • Method Detail

      • Name

        public java.lang.String Name()
        Gets this column's name. This method is used by the SQL query generation code.
        Returns:
        The name of the column, as a string.

      • SetName

        public void SetName(java.lang.String s)
        Sets this column's name. The database manager is responsible for setting the column names of each column in DataObject instances immediately after construction. You should not ever need to call it.
        Parameters:
        s - The name of this column.

      • SQLFieldValue

        public abstract java.lang.String SQLFieldValue()
        Children implement this method to return a string that can be injected directly into an SQL statement, representing the current value of this field.
        Returns:
        the current value of this field as a string that can be inserted into an SQL query.

      • DBUpdateValue

        public abstract void DBUpdateValue(java.lang.String new_value)
        Children implement this method to update their current value from the data extracted from the DB. The data will be passed through as a string, it is up to the child class to parse the data correctly.
        Parameters:
        new_value - - the value returned from the database.

      • SQLColumnDescriptor

        public static java.lang.String SQLColumnDescriptor()
        This method returns the column type that the database will use to store these columns.
        Returns:
        An SQL fragment that can be injected directly into queries.
